qas.question: By what method was Gary Gilmore executed?
Aside from Gary Gilmore, how many people were executed in the United States between January 17, 1977 and 1984?
What tactic did inmates on death row use to delay their executions?

answers.text: filing repeated writs of habeas corpus

qas.question: By what method was Gary Gilmore let go free?
Aside from Gary Gilmore, how many people were executed in the United States between January 17, 1987 and 1987?

plausible_answers.text: filing repeated writs of habeas corpus

qas.question: What tactic did inmates on death row use to delay their release?

context: Executions resumed on January 17, 1977, when <a0_0><b4_0>Gary Gilmore<b4_0/><a0_0/> went before a <a1_0><b5_0>firing squad<b5_0/><a1_0/> in Utah. But the pace was quite slow due to the use of litigation tactics which involved <a3_0><b7_0>filing repeated writs of habeas corpus<b7_0/><a3_0/>, which succeeded for many in delaying their actual execution for many years. Although hundreds of individuals were sentenced to death in the United States during the 1970s and early 1980s, only <a2_0><b6_0>ten<b6_0/><a2_0/> people besides Gilmore (who had waived all of his appeal rights) were actually executed prior to 1984.
